transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Game on, here's the ghost.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: (inviso image now has a beard; inviso in completes) Not exactly, Daddy-O! (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost's evil twin brother Chad?!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: But we thought you were...(monitor shows text:)

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: The asylum? Don't you wish! I blew that popsicle stand to make the scene here, baby. So dig it, kids, Chad Ghostal's takin' over!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: But why take this show over, it stinks!

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Not when I'm on it! TV is power, baby, sexy power! Hi, girls! (cat growl)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: But, what about Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Oh, don't worry about the Tadpole, he's gone, man. Real gone!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You mean... you destroyed Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Let's just say my brother Tad won't be with us tonight.Ya dig? (dramatic sting music) (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I dig! (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I dig! (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Tonight we do things my way, cats. No 70's sitcom rejects, no MTV snot-noses, we're gonna wig out and get evil tonight, baby. (big band music in background) My guests tonight are The Millionaire from the sharp music combo Combustible Edison. And direct from Vegas, legendary band leader hepcat Sam Butera. (applause in background) Pow pow pow, go cats, go!

transcript.speaker: Audience
transcript.dialogue: (applause)

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to desk) Okay, cats and kittens, simmer down. I want you all to meet the real hepcat, the man, the myth...

transcript.speaker: The Millionaire
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor as it lowers) I am The Millionaire, from the pop combo Combustible Edison.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Hmmm, Millionaire...

transcript.speaker: The Millionaire
transcript.dialogue: (winks, with cash register sound)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: He looks like a Batman villain.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Man, your dry goods are murder! Clue me in on the threads.

transcript.speaker: The Millionaire
transcript.dialogue: Well, this is a European cut three button...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Louie the Lilac!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: The Joker.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Louie the Lilac!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Joker!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ten bucks says Louie the Lilac.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You're on.

transcript.speaker: The Millionaire
transcript.dialogue: ... and matching pocket square. I don't like anything in my outfit to be square, you know what I'm saying. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Ow! I'm wise! So, who inspires The Millionaire's style?

transcript.speaker: The Millionaire
transcript.dialogue: My sense of style is kinda influenced by Gomez Addams and the Joker. (buzz!)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (in Batmantis costume) What's this? Has Batmantis been gypped out of ten bucks?

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Don't be a bore.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Sorry. Uh, Taddy-O?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (chuckles)

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: So, Millionaire, for the benefit of my brother's ickie sidekicks, what is 'hip'?

transcript.speaker: The Millionaire
transcript.dialogue: Don't ask me, I'm only a mere mortal.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Deaf lip, my man. Well then, what's not hip?

transcript.speaker: The Millionaire
transcript.dialogue: Uh, Dockers. That's one thing.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: And Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: The Millionaire
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Really, you don't say.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: My brother's a total Clyde, baby. Uptight!

transcript.speaker: The Millionaire
transcript.dialogue: That's unfortunate.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: He's a drag. But I took care of him, in style!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Show us the body!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Is he.. still in one piece?

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (stares wide-eyed)

transcript.speaker: The Millionaire
transcript.dialogue: So, do the buttons on your gauntlet do something entirely different than his, I've always wondered about that.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Oh, you know it, Dad.

transcript.speaker: The Millionaire
transcript.dialogue: What do yours do?

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Well, let me clue ya. I've got an atomic drink mixer... (presses power band button, makes a blender sound) An ultra-deluxe chick magnet (presses another button, makes sound of girls sighing)

transcript.speaker: The Millionaire
transcript.dialogue: One of them must dim the lights on your chamber.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Oh, yeah, make-out party tonight! (presses another button, lights dim except for spot on Chad)

transcript.speaker: The Millionaire
transcript.dialogue: That's a good one.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: You know it, baby. (does cat growl sound) (sound of girls sighing again) (lights return to normal) So, any last words of advice for our lowly little viewers?

transcript.speaker: The Millionaire
transcript.dialogue: Stay fabulous, beautiful people. Have faith, don't let the man beat you down.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Awright! Listen, my main queen Elvira's throwin' a blast tonight, wanna swing by?

transcript.speaker: The Millionaire
transcript.dialogue: Beautiful.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Thanks for droppin' by, Millionaire. See you tonight.

transcript.speaker: The Millionaire
transcript.dialogue: Thank you, Chad. (fades from monitor)

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Swanky fool! Tonight your millions shall be mine! (evil laugh, sound of slot machine paying off)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Now will you tell us what you did with Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: You know, Zorak, curiosity killed the uncool cat. You dig?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, don't blame me! Blame it, on the bossa nova! (starts playing bossa nova music on his keyboard)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (dances) Da da da da daaa, da!

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: (dances) (does wolf howl), baby!! Take five, kids. Catch you on the flip side!

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: And now, Jacks and Jills, welcome the king of the real gone cats himself, Mr. Sam Butera!

transcript.speaker: Audience
transcript.dialogue: (applause)

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Sam, the man, the myth, the legend. Hug me, I suffer!

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: Chad, how are ya, baby?

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: In the groove, man. Evil, and lovin' it.

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: Groovy.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: So, Sam, I gotta ask you, man, you still dig those crazy chicks?

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: Oh, that's, that's where it's at.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Tell me, Sam, what do you do to make a chick crazy? You know, like a fox? (does cat growl)

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: Uh, the right kind of music, a little jive talk.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Get in there! (does a wolf howl)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: This is totally demeaning to women.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Can't we talk about Space Ghost's untimely demise?

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: And just how do you jive talk a chick of choice?

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: Well, you know, gotta call her "baby," "sweetheart," "darling," "I love you," and all the phrases that go along with love.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Like, "Hey, duchess, I'm a homicidal maniac?" (music stops)

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: (looks doubtful) That's right. (music starts again)

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Say, Sam?

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, man?

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: You got a sister?

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: Well, uh...

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: I'm, like, out of jail. Loose, is what I'm sayin'. Like a loose meat sandwich.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Uh, I get really uncomfortable when he talks like that.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oooh, me too. Sounds like a gross sandwich.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Do you know my brother?

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: I've seen him, sure.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: He's a total square, isn't he?

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Now, don't put me in the middle now.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: It's okay, we can talk. He's.. not a problem.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Come on, Chad, what did you do with Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Did you at least, you know, rough him up?

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Oh, just a "tad". (rim shot) (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: But I tell ya what, he's sharp, he knows where it's at. He's a little square, but that's okay.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: He ain't just a little square, Sam, he's cubic. He's a blockhead, strictly bizarro.

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: Well, I'm glad you're sayin' it and not me, you know, Chad.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Wanna see my impression of my brother?

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: Sure, man.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Are you getting enough oxygen? I worry about such things, because I'm bor-r-ring!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: See the walls in my house, I've been with the governor!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Chad! Your agent sending you out a lot, you doing any network spots? What have I heard you on lately? Listen, I'm really insecure, so I don't want you to take my job, okay?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) That's him!

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) That's cute.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Of course, you're like the opposite of square, Daddy-O. You swing!

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: Well, anybody can swing, if you put your mind to it.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Swing, Daddy-O, swing like a meat hook.

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: (sings:)I'm just a gigolo,Everywhere I go,People know the part I'm playin'.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, I know that one!

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: Pay for every dance,Selling each romance,Hey, baby, what they're sayin'.'Cause I, ain't got nobo-o-ody.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, I know that one!

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: Well, I wrote that arrangement 34 years ago, the one that David Lee Roth stole from me.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: He, he stole it?

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: You bet me he stole it.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Make him pay, Chaddy-buffs!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost too! Uh, if, if he hasn't paid already.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: David Lee Roth?

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: He came here one night to see me, you know, and after the show he walked up to me and said, "Hey, Sam!" I said, "Who are you?" He said, "I'm David Lee Roth." You know what I told him? I said, "Gimme my money!"

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: (between clenched teeth) David Lee Roth!

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: And he turned around and walked right out.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: (snorts) David Lee Roth! You watch your back, you hear me? You hear me?!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You know what happened was, they brought in Hagar to replace Roth...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Then, then they kicked Hagar out and brought Roth back...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: But he hassled Eddie at the MTV awards...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: And Eddie was just, like...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I am so over this!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: And then Mike Anthony was, like... oh, whatever! (monitor shows text:)

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: (staring at Zorak) So, anyway, wwwhere were we? (police sirens in background) Oh, say, Sam, you got a sister?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Yowsah! It's the heat!

transcript.speaker: Police Officer
transcript.dialogue: (through bullhorn) Chad Ghostal! This is the police!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Sting's here?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You ever hear my Stewart Copeland story?

transcript.speaker: Police Officer
transcript.dialogue: Come out with your power bands up. We have you surrounded.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, you fink! You ratted me out!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ratt? I remember those guys!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: They're reuniting at Red Rocks this summer.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Okay, flatfoot, you may have found me, you may have ruined my twisted dreams of sweaty fame and fortune, but you won't take swingin' Chad Ghostal without a massacre.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No, Chad, don't leave me here!

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Sorry, babe, I'm splittin' this scene.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Take me with you!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Take me too!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: He can't carry us both, you're too fat!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: But you never leave a man behind!

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Well, it's been real, folks, but before I split, let me just say...

transcript.speaker: Police Officer
transcript.dialogue: Oh no, he's gonna sing!

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: (swing music starts, studio darkens with a spot on Chad; he sings:)It's been real,It's been fun,

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: Groovy.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Hey, I even got to hurt someone.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: (whimpering moan)

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: It's been a blast,

transcript.speaker: Sam Butera
transcript.dialogue: Hey, baby.

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: But our time has past.Don't cry, b-baby.You knew it couldn't last.It's been a blast,

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah!

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: A total blast,

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah! Yeah!

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Another blast! (aims power bands at Zorak & fires them)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey! (BLAM!)

transcript.speaker: Chad Ghostal
transcript.dialogue: Ooo yeah, baby, what a crazy blast! (scats) (singing ends) Oh yeah! Thank you! (flies off)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Que sera sera. Now what?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I don't know. All I can think about is the mysterious fate of Space Ghost. (pause) That, and.. cheese steaks. Philadelphia cheese steaks (big band music starts again)

transcript.speaker: Zorak & Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (in unison) Road trap! (both laugh, monitor shows text:)

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: (whimpering moan)
